The Geodesic Viewshed tool identifies the locations on a raster surface that are visible to the input observer locations.

The elevation raster on which the viewshed will be calculated.

The observer locations for which the viewshed will be calculated.

Optimizes viewshed calculation based on either speed or accuracy.

The amount of uncertainty in the elevation values of the Input elevation surface value.

The coefficient of the refraction of visible light in air.

The maximum viewing distance for the viewshed calculation.

The distance can be defined by a value and its units or from a field in the Input observer point or line features value.

The minimum viewing distance for the viewshed calculation.

The distance can be defined by a value and its units or from a field in the Input observer point or line features value.

Specifies whether the maximum and minimum viewing distances will be measured in 3D distance or 2D distance.

If unchecked, the viewing distances will be treated as 2D Euclidean distances. If checked, the viewing distances will be treated as 3D distances.

The surface elevation of the observer locations.

The elevation can be defined by a value and its units or from a field in the Input observer point or line features value.

The height of the observers above ground.

The height can be defined by a value and its units or from a field in the Input observer point or line features value.

The height of targets on the ground.

The height can be defined by a value and its units or from a field in the Input observer point or line features value.

The start angle of the horizontal scan range.

The angle can be defined by a value from 0 to 360 or from a field in the Input observer point or line features value.

The end angle of the horizontal scan range.

The angle can be defined by a value from 0 to 360 or from a field in the Input observer point or line features value.

The upper vertical angle limit of the scan relative to the horizontal plane.

The angle can be defined by a value from –90 to 90 or from a field in the Input observer point or line features value.

The lower vertical angle limit of the scan relative to the horizontal plane.

The angle can be defined by a value from –90 to 90 or from a field in the Input observer point or line features value.

The name of the viewshed raster layer that will be created and added to the map. This layer contains the visible areas the observers can see, and the cell values represent the number of observers that can view the cells.

The name of the above ground level (AGL) raster layer that will be created and added to the map.

The type of output that will be created. The output can be a tiled imagery layer or a dynamic imagery layer.

The name of the folder in My Content where the result will be saved.
